Posts.Content: Contact me and I will explain things to you that can clear up some of your questions. I will explain what this says and why. Don't panic is what I am saying.
Posts.Title: Request for advice

Posts.Content: There are logical reasons why there are re-occurances with any cancer, the answer may surprize some of you but it will make sense to those who understand the way the body works. You must make the body healthy first. The treatments don't do that. They remove the symptom that's all folks. Take the algae out of the pool water, BUT don't change the environment in the water and what happens...... it comes back because you never  corrected the condition...... comments anyone.
Posts.Title: 3rd time for my mom

Posts.Content: On Jul 17, 2011 3:26 PM GramNurse wrote: thanks for responding. I know I am just overwhelmed. I was totally ok until finding out I have to take chemo... I am 54, working fulltime, in school, 2 quarters away from completing a degree as a Nurse Practitioner and my plate is already way too full.  To have this... just not good.  I will push forward... I have no choice.  My mother died from colon and lung cancer 21 days after diagnosis... I will not let that happen to me! Don't do something you don't know enough about. I have good info. for you. Check your notifications
Posts.Title: New Diagnosis

Posts.Content: Question? Dr's are smart and well trained from the best medical Universities and take an oath to do the patient no harm right?Then how come every person that I have met that was diagnosed with C was never told by these professionals about how important nutrition is for the body. There are only two plausible answers: 1. They don't know, which is pathetic. And  2. They don't care? Which is inexcusable. I'm not referring to a nutritionist. I'm talking about our oncologist who was ready to give my wife chemo without question but had NO clue about nutrition. Once again, follow the money folks.
Posts.Title: Nutritional suggestions ?

Posts.Content: Think about this procedure. Your body will never be the same and there are many ways to prevent this issue that you will not learn from most Dr's. It is something I will share with you because it is too late for me too go back and undo it.
Posts.Title: Bi-Lateral masectomy

Posts.Content: You asked for help , so I assume you will take my suggestion seriously. Contact  NCRF.org   They are compassionate people that will give you info.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: elective mastecomy

Posts.Content: Hello. I am interested to know why you are looking to do this. Can you send me a private reply? I will tellyou like you were my own sister why not to do it until you have heard ALL of the facts to consider. I can't say who I am ,but I do know more than most people on this board. I am not criticizing others and I know they mean well.  But, don't you want the real facts you may be unaware of. How can I make this statement you may ask. I lived through it, and I will share with you what the Dr's didn't tell you. Here I am and I will reply......
Posts.Title: elective double masectomy
